columns.text: In this problem, we will calculate the present value of perpetuity for the seventh year if the interest rate is 5.3% and the perpetual payments are $6,400.

In solving the exercise, we will consider the following details from the problem:

| Particulars         |        |
|---------------------|--------|
| Rate                | 5.3%   |
| Constant cash flow    | $6,400 |
| Period to calculate | 7      |
To determine the value of the perpetuity in the seventh year, we will first calculate the present value of the perpetuity.

First, let's determine what perpetuity is and how the present value of such is calculated.

Perpetuity refers to an annuity that is constant with no end. The primary component of perpetuity is the rate and the constant cash flow. To determine the present value of an annuity, the constant cash flow is divided by the interest rate. Hence we will use the following formula:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Present value of Perpetuity} &=\dfrac{C}{r}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$C$, which represent the constant cash flow\
$r$, which indicated the rate
Next, considering the present value of the perpetuity as the future value, we will now calculate the present value of the perpetuity in the seventh year.

In calculating the present value, we will consider the following details:

| Particulars         |        |
|---------------------|--------|
| Rate                | 5.3%   |
| Future value    | $120,754.72 |
| Period to calculate | 7      |

To calculate the present value of the future value, the future value is divided by the factor of rate and the period. Hence, we will utilized the following formula:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{PV} &=\dfrac{FV}{\left(1 + r\right)^{t}}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$PV$, which means the present value\
$FV$, which refers to the future value\
$t$, which represent the period\
$r$, which indicate the discount rate

To conclude, to determine the value of the perpetuity on the seventh year, we first compute the present value of the perpetuity and consider it as the future value in calculating the present value on the seventh year. As a result of our calculation, the value is $84,121.21.
